title: Polar Equation of Conic
text:
For a conic with a focus at the origin, if the directrix is $$x=p$$ or $$x=-p$$, where $$p$$ is a positive real number, and the eccentricity is a positive real number e, the conic has a polar equation
$$r= rac{e p}{1+e cos\left(	hetaight)}$$ or $$r= rac{e p}{1-e cos\left(	hetaight)}$$
For a conic with a focus at the origin, if the directrix is $$y=p$$ or $$y=-p$$, where $$p$$ is a positive real number, and the eccentricity is a positive real number e, the conic has a polar equation
$$r= rac{e p}{1+e sin\left(	hetaight)}$$ or $$r= rac{e p}{1-e sin\left(	hetaight)}$$

title: Directrix
text: The directrix is $$y=-p$$. Which trigonometric function is in the denominator?
speech: The directrix is , y is equal to negative p, . Which trigonometric function is in the denominator?
pacedSpeech: The directrix is  , y is equal to negative p,
. Which trigonometric function is in the denominator?

title: Polar Equation
text: Our polar equation takes the form $$r=\frac{e p}{1-e sin\left(\theta\right)}$$ as identified by the directrix $$y=-p$$.
speech: Our polar equation takes the form  r is equal to fraction, e p, over, 1 minus esin of theta,   as identified by the directrix  y is equal to negative p .

as identified by the directrix   y is equal to negative p

title: Numerator
text: The numerator is the product of the eccentricity and the absolute of the directrix, |p|. What is the numerator?
speech: The numerator is the product of the eccentricity and the absolute of the directrix, |p|. What is the numerator?
pacedSpeech: The numerator is the product of the eccentricity and the absolute of the directrix, |p|. What is the numerator?

title: Eccentricity
text: The eccentricity is the magnitude of the coefficient of the trigonometric function in the denominator. Thus, what is the coefficient of the trigonometric function?
speech: The eccentricity is the magnitude of the coefficient of the trigonometric function in the denominator. Thus, what is the coefficient of the trigonometric function?
